summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York transmitting an updated prosecution memo regarding the Epstein case, seeking feedback before sending it to supervisors. The memo discusses potential charges and legal issues.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email transmitting an updated prosecution memo regarding the Epstein case, seeking feedback before sending it to chiefs.

events.title: Prosecution Memo Update
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends an updated prosecution memo regarding the Epstein case, seeking feedback before sending it to supervisors.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.context: Jurisdiction of the prosecutor sending the memo.

locations.name: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
locations.context: Address of the Assistant United States Attorney's office.

keyFacts: An updated prosecution memo regarding the Epstein case was circulated among prosecutors in March 2020.
The memo includes a highlighted section whose accuracy is questioned by the author.
The author considered but did not include a charge of endangering the welfare of a minor due to a circuit split issue.
The document shows ongoing prosecutorial work on the Epstein case in early 2020.
